p.s: Description of Methylosinus sporium sp. nov.
Methylosinus sporium (spo'ri.um. L. n. spora, spore; N. L. n. sporium, spore former)
The characteristics are the same as the characteristics given in the genus description above, including the following traits.
Cells are vibrioid to rod shaped and 0.5 to 1.0 μm wide by 1.5 to 3.0 μm long.
Colonies on NMS agar are opaque, have smooth surfaces, are low convex and circular with entire edges, have a butyrous consistency, and are a buff to tan.
A diffusible brown pigment may be produced.
A bright red prodigiosine-like pigment may also occur.
Selenite and triphenyltetrazolium chloride are not reduced.
Methane and methanol are the only known sole carbon and energy sources.
The G+C content of the DNA is 65 to 67 mol% (Ti).
The type strain is NCIMB 11126 (= ACM 3306 = ATCC 35069).
